Piping insulation schedules in first three articles below specify commonly used insulation materials

findings.issue: Performance requirements reference ASCE/SEI 7 without specifying the edition year. For DSA projects under CBC 2022, the correct reference is ASCE 7-22. Unspecified editions can lead to using outdated seismic design criteria.
findings.existingText: Structural Performance:  Hangers and supports for HVAC piping and equipment shall withstand the effects of gravity loads and stresses within limits and under conditions indicated according to ASCE/SEI 7.
findings.replacementText: Structural Performance:  Hangers and supports for HVAC piping and equipment shall withstand the effects of gravity loads and stresses within limits and under conditions indicated according to ASCE/SEI 7-22 as adopted by CBC 2022.

findings.issue: Seismic-restraint design is mentioned but there is no reference to DSA IR A-6 or OSHPD seismic certification requirements. For California K-12 projects under DSA jurisdiction, seismic bracing must comply with DSA Interpretation of Regulations (IR) A-6.
findings.replacementText: Seismic restraint design shall comply with DSA IR A-6. Submit seismic certification documentation including OSHPD pre-approval (OPA) or DSA pre-approval for seismic restraint components and assemblies.

findings.issue: Shop Drawings are required to be signed and sealed by a qualified professional engineer, but there is no requirement that the engineer be licensed in California. For DSA projects, the delegated design engineer must be a California-licensed professional engineer.
findings.existingText: Shop Drawings:  Signed and sealed by a qualified professional engineer.
findings.replacementText: Shop Drawings:  Signed and sealed by a professional engineer licensed in the State of California.
findings.codeReference: California Business and Professions Code Section 6700

findings.issue: Reference to MSS SP-58 should include the edition year for clarity and to ensure the correct version is used. Current edition is MSS SP-58-2018.
findings.existingText: Description:  MSS SP-58, Types 1 through 58, factory-fabricated components.
findings.replacementText: Description:  MSS SP-58-2018, Types 1 through 58, factory-fabricated components.

findings.issue: Reference to MSS SP-69 should include the edition year. This issue applies throughout this section where MSS SP-69 is referenced without a year.
findings.existingText: Description:  MSS SP-69, Type 59
findings.replacementText: Description:  MSS SP-69-2018, Type 59

findings.issue: Reference to MFMA-4 should include the edition year. Current edition is MFMA-4-2004 (R2017).
findings.existingText: Standard:  MFMA-4.
findings.replacementText: Standard:  MFMA-4-2004 (R2017).

findings.issue: ASTM C 533 reference should include the edition year. Current edition is ASTM C533-19.
findings.existingText: Insulation-Insert Material for Cold Piping:  Water-repellent treated, ASTM C 533, Type I calcium silite with 100-psig minimum compressive strength.
findings.replacementText: Insulation-Insert Material for Cold Piping:  Water-repellent treated, ASTM C533-19, Type I calcium silicate with 100-psig minimum compressive strength.

findings.issue: Typographical error: 'calcium silite' should be 'calcium silite' is misspelled.
findings.existingText: calcium silite
findings.replacementText: calcium silicate

findings.issue: Pipe stand vertical members specify cadmium-plated steel. Cadmium plating is restricted under California Proposition 65 and various environmental regulations. Consider specifying zinc-plated or stainless steel as alternatives.
findings.existingText: Vertical Members:  Two or more cadmium-plated-steel or stainless-steel, continuous-thread rods.
findings.replacementText: Vertical Members:  Two or more zinc-plated-steel or stainless-steel, continuous-thread rods.

findings.issue: ASTM A 36/A 36M reference should include the edition year for structural steel. Current edition is ASTM A36/A36M-19.
findings.existingText: Structural Steel:  ASTM A 36/A 36M, carbon-steel plates, shapes, and bars; black and galvanized.
findings.replacementText: Structural Steel:  ASTM A36/A36M-19, carbon-steel plates, shapes, and bars; black and galvanized.

findings.issue: Grout compressive strength is specified as 5000-psi at 28 days. For equipment supports, ASTM C1107 grout should typically achieve minimum 5000 psi at 28 days, but the reference to ASTM C 1107 should include edition year. Current edition is ASTM C1107-21.
findings.existingText: Grout:  ASTM C 1107, factory-mixed and -packaged, dry, hydraulic-cement, nonshrink and nonmetallic grout
findings.replacementText: Grout:  ASTM C1107-21, factory-mixed and -packaged, dry, hydraulic-cement, nonshrink and nonmetallic grout

findings.issue: Reference to MSS SP-89 should include the edition year. Current edition is MSS SP-89-2019.
findings.existingText: Comply with MSS SP-69 and MSS SP-89.
findings.replacementText: Comply with MSS SP-69-2018 and MSS SP-89-2019.

findings.issue: AWS D1.1/D1.1M reference should include edition year. Current edition is AWS D1.1/D1.1M:2020.
findings.existingText: Weld steel according to AWS D1.1/D1.1M.
findings.replacementText: Weld steel according to AWS D1.1/D1.1M:2020.

findings.issue: Reference to ASME B31.9 for pipe slopes and deflections is appropriate, but should include edition year. Current edition is ASME B31.9-2020. This applies throughout this section.
findings.existingText: not exceed maximum pipe deflections allowed by ASME B31.9
findings.replacementText: not exceed maximum pipe deflections allowed by ASME B31.9-2020

findings.issue: Reference to ASTM A 780 should include edition year for galvanizing repair. Current edition is ASTM A780/A780M-20.
findings.existingText: apply galvanizing-repair paint to comply with ASTM A 780.
findings.replacementText: apply galvanizing-repair paint to comply with ASTM A780/A780M-20.

findings.issue: Reference to MFMA-103 should include edition year. Current edition is MFMA-103-2018.
findings.existingText: Comply with MFMA-103 for metal framing system selections
findings.replacementText: Comply with MFMA-103-2018 for metal framing system selections

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Pipe label lettering size is specified as 'At least 1-1/2 incheshigh' which appears to be a typographical error and formatting issue. Should be 'At least 1-1/2 inches high'. Additionally, ASME A13.1 specifies minimum letter heights based on pipe diameter which should be referenced.
findings.existingText: Lettering Size:  At least 1-1/2 incheshigh.
findings.replacementText: Lettering Size:  At least 1-1/2 inches high, or as required by ASME A13.1-2020 based on pipe outside diameter, whichever is greater.

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Pipe labels section does not reference ASME A13.1 for pipe marking color coding and sizing requirements. ASME A13.1 is the industry standard for pipe marking.
findings.replacementText: Pipe labels shall comply with ASME A13.1-2020 for color coding, letter sizing, and placement requirements.

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Chilled-Water Piping color schedule lists 'Letter Color: White' and 'Letter Color: Black' consecutively, which appears to be an editing error with duplicate entries.
findings.existingText:
Letter Color:  White.

Letter Color:  Black.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Reference to ASHRAE 62.1 and ASHRAE/IESNA 90.1 should include edition years. Current editions are ASHRAE 62.1-2022 and ASHRAE 90.1-2022. California Title 24 Part 6 (Energy Code) references specific ASHRAE standard versions.
findings.existingText:
ASHRAE Compliance:  Applicable requirements in ASHRAE 62.1, Section 7.2.2 - "Air Balancing."

ASHRAE/IESNA Compliance:  Applicable requirements in ASHRAE/IESNA 90.1, Section 6.7.2.3 - "System Balancing."
findings.replacementText:
ASHRAE Compliance:  Applicable requirements in ASHRAE 62.1-2022, Section 7.2.2 - "Air Balancing."

ASHRAE/IESNA Compliance:  Applicable requirements in ASHRAE 90.1-2022, Section 6.7.2.3 - "System Balancing," or California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6, whichever is more stringent.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Reference to ASHRAE 111 should include the edition year. Current edition is ASHRAE 111-2008 (RA 2017).
findings.existingText: Instrumentation Type, Quantity, Accuracy, and Calibration:  As described in ASHRAE 111, Section 5, "Instrumentation."
findings.replacementText: Instrumentation Type, Quantity, Accuracy, and Calibration:  As described in ASHRAE 111-2008 (RA 2017), Section 5, "Instrumentation."

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Reference to SMACNA's 'HVAC Systems - Testing, Adjusting, and Balancing' should include the edition year. Current edition is 2002 (3rd Edition).
findings.existingText: Perform testing and balancing procedures on each system according to the procedures contained in AABC's "National Standards for Total System Balance", ASHRAE 111, and SMACNA's "HVAC Systems - Testing, Adjusting, and Balancing"
findings.replacementText: Perform testing and balancing procedures on each system according to the procedures contained in AABC's "National Standards for Total System Balance" (current edition), ASHRAE 111-2008 (RA 2017), and SMACNA's "HVAC Systems - Testing, Adjusting, and Balancing" (3rd Edition, 2002)
findings.codeReference: SMACNA HVAC Systems - Testing, Adjusting, and Balancing

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Reference to Section 233113 'Metal Ducts' for duct leakage class is appropriate, but there should be a specific reference to SMACNA duct leakage class requirements. For California K-12 projects, duct leakage testing is typically required.
findings.existingText: Examine ceiling plenums and underfloor air plenums used for supply, return, or relief air to verify that they meet the leakage class of connected ducts as specified in Section 233113 "Metal Ducts"
findings.replacementText: Examine ceiling plenums and underfloor air plenums used for supply, return, or relief air to verify that they meet the leakage class of connected ducts as specified in Section 233113 "Metal Ducts" and SMACNA HVAC Duct Construction Standards - Metal and Flexible (4th Edition, 2022)

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Reference to AMCA 201 should include edition year. AMCA 201 'Fans and Systems' current edition is 2020.
findings.existingText: To calculate system effects for air systems, use tables and charts found in AMCA 201, "Fans and Systems,"
findings.replacementText: To calculate system effects for air systems, use tables and charts found in AMCA 201-2020, "Fans and Systems,"

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: The requirement for additional TAB within 90 days and during near-peak summer and winter conditions may be impractical for school projects where occupancy schedules and HVAC operation during breaks may not represent design conditions. Consider clarifying expectations for seasonal testing at K-12 facilities.
findings.existingText: Seasonal Periods:  If initial TAB procedures were not performed during near-peak summer and winter conditions, perform additional TAB during near-peak summer and winter conditions.
findings.replacementText: Seasonal Periods:  If initial TAB procedures were not performed during near-peak summer and winter conditions, perform additional TAB during near-peak summer and winter conditions when school is in session and HVAC systems are operating under normal occupied conditions.

findings.issue: ASTM C 553 and ASTM C 1290 references should include edition years. Current editions are ASTM C553-19 and ASTM C1290-21.
findings.existingText: Comply with ASTM C 553, Type II and ASTM C 1290, Type III with factory-applied FSK jacket.
findings.replacementText: Comply with ASTM C553-19, Type II and ASTM C1290-21, Type III with factory-applied FSK jacket.

findings.issue: ASTM C 612 reference should include edition year. Current edition is ASTM C612-22.
findings.existingText: Comply with ASTM C 612, Type IA or Type IB.
findings.replacementText: Comply with ASTM C612-22, Type IA or Type IB.

findings.issue: ASTM C 1393 reference should include edition year. Current edition is ASTM C1393-22.
findings.existingText: complying with ASTM C 1393, Type II or Type IIIA Category 2
findings.replacementText: complying with ASTM C1393-22, Type II or Type IIIA Category 2

findings.issue: Fire-rated insulation systems reference 1-hour or 2-hour ratings but do not specify compliance with California Building Code requirements for fire-resistance-rated construction or UL assembly requirements. DSA requires proper documentation of fire-rated assemblies.
findings.replacementText: Fire-rated insulation systems shall be listed and labeled by a nationally recognized testing laboratory (NRTL) and installed in accordance with the listing requirements. Submit UL or equivalent listing documentation to DSA for approval.

findings.issue: Military Specification MIL-A-3316C was last updated in 1987 and is considered obsolete. Consider referencing current ASTM standards for adhesives or accepting manufacturer's recommended adhesive with documented performance.
findings.existingText: Mineral-Fiber Adhesive:  Comply with MIL-A-3316C, Class 2, Grade A.
findings.replacementText: Mineral-Fiber Adhesive:  Comply with MIL-A-3316C, Class 2, Grade A, or provide manufacturer's recommended adhesive with documentation demonstrating equivalent performance.

findings.issue: MIL-PRF-19565C reference for mastics is a military specification. Consider adding ASTM or other current industry standards as acceptable alternatives.
findings.existingText: Materials shall be compatible with insulation materials, jackets, and substrates; comply with MIL-PRF-19565C, Type II.
findings.replacementText: Materials shall be compatible with insulation materials, jackets, and substrates; comply with MIL-PRF-19565C, Type II, or equivalent commercial standard.

findings.issue: ASTM E 96/E 96M reference should include edition year. Current edition is ASTM E96/E96M-22.
findings.existingText: Water-Vapor Permeance:  ASTM E 96/E 96M, Procedure B
findings.replacementText: Water-Vapor Permeance:  ASTM E96/E96M-22, Procedure B

findings.issue: ASTM C 1136 reference should include edition year. Current edition is ASTM C1136-19. This applies throughout this section where ASTM C 1136 is referenced.
findings.existingText: FSK Jacket:  Aluminum-foil, fiberglass-reinforced scrim with kraft-paper backing; complying with ASTM C 1136, Type II.
findings.replacementText: FSK Jacket:  Aluminum-foil, fiberglass-reinforced scrim with kraft-paper backing; complying with ASTM C1136-19, Type II.

findings.issue: ASTM C 921 reference should include edition year. Current edition is ASTM C921-19. This applies throughout this section.
findings.existingText: Field-applied jackets shall comply with ASTM C 921, Type I
findings.replacementText: Field-applied jackets shall comply with ASTM C921-19, Type I

findings.issue: Typographical error: 'irestopping' should be 'firestopping' in the section reference.
findings.existingText: Comply with requirements in Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping"irestopping and fire-resistive joint sealers.
findings.replacementText: Comply with requirements in Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping" for firestopping and fire-resistive joint sealers.

findings.issue: Surface-burning characteristics reference ASTM E 84 but should also reference California requirements. ASTM E 84 should include edition year. Current edition is ASTM E84-23a.
findings.existingText: Surface-Burning Characteristics:  For insulation and related materials, as determined by testing identical products according to ASTM E 84
findings.replacementText: Surface-Burning Characteristics:  For insulation and related materials, as determined by testing identical products according to ASTM E84-23a

findings.issue: Indoor and outdoor duct insulation schedules specify internal lining per Section 233113 for exposed ducts. However, California schools have specific indoor air quality requirements that may restrict or prohibit internal duct lining in certain applications. Verify compliance with CALGreen and DSA requirements for school IAQ.
findings.replacementText: Internal duct lining shall comply with California Mechanical Code Section 603.0 and CALGreen requirements for indoor air quality in educational facilities. Where internal lining is used, provide antimicrobial treatment complying with EPA registration requirements.

findings.issue: ASTM C 534 reference should include edition year. Current edition is ASTM C534/C534M-22.
findings.existingText: Comply with ASTM C 534, Type I for tubular materials.
findings.replacementText: Comply with ASTM C534/C534M-22, Type I for tubular materials.

findings.issue: ASTM C 547 reference should include edition year. Current edition is ASTM C547-19.
findings.existingText: Comply with ASTM C 547, Type I, Grade A, with factory-applied ASJ.
findings.replacementText: Comply with ASTM C547-19, Type I, Grade A, with factory-applied ASJ.

findings.issue: ASTM C 195 reference for mineral-fiber insulating cement should include edition year. Current edition is ASTM C195-22.
findings.existingText: Mineral-Fiber Insulating Cement:  Comply with ASTM C 195.
findings.replacementText: Mineral-Fiber Insulating Cement:  Comply with ASTM C195-22.

findings.issue: The Piping Insulation Schedule, General and Indoor Piping Insulation Schedule sections specify insulation thicknesses, but do not reference California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 minimum insulation requirements. Insulation thicknesses must meet or exceed California Energy Code requirements.
findings.replacementText: Piping insulation thicknesses shall meet or exceed California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 requirements. Where specified thicknesses differ from code requirements, provide the greater thickness.

findings.issue: Chilled water insulation thickness is specified as 'Mineral-Fiber, Preformed Pipe, Type I: 1 inch thick' without specifying by pipe size. California Energy Code and ASHRAE 90.1 require varying insulation thicknesses based on pipe diameter. A single thickness for all pipe sizes may not comply with energy code requirements.
findings.existingText: Mineral-Fiber, Preformed Pipe, Type I:  1 inch thick.
findings.replacementText: Mineral-Fiber, Preformed Pipe, Type I: Thickness per California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 Table 120.3-A based on pipe size, but not less than 1 inch.
findings.codeReference: California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 Table 120.3-A

findings.issue: Heating hot water insulation thickness is specified as 2 inches for all pipe sizes. California Energy Code requires varying insulation thicknesses based on pipe diameter and fluid temperature. Verify compliance with Title 24 Part 6.
findings.existingText: Mineral-Fiber, Preformed Pipe, Type I: 2 inches thick.
findings.replacementText: Mineral-Fiber, Preformed Pipe, Type I: Thickness per California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 Table 120.3-A based on pipe size and fluid temperature, but not less than 1-1/2 inches for pipes NPS 1-1/4 and smaller, 2 inches for pipes NPS 1-1/2 through NPS 4, and 2-1/2 inches for pipes larger than NPS 4.
findings.codeReference: California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 Table 120.3-A

findings.issue: ASTM B 209 reference for aluminum jacket should include edition year. Current edition is ASTM B209-21.
findings.existingText: Aluminum Jacket:  Comply with ASTM B 209, Alloy 3003, 3005, 3105, or 5005, Temper H-14.
findings.replacementText: Aluminum Jacket:  Comply with ASTM B209-21, Alloy 3003, 3005, 3105, or 5005, Temper H-14.

findings.issue: MIL-A-24179A reference for flexible elastomeric adhesive is a military specification that may be obsolete or superseded. Consider accepting manufacturer's recommended adhesive.
findings.existingText: Flexible Elastomeric and Polyolefin Adhesive:  Comply with MIL-A-24179A, Type II, Class I.
findings.replacementText: Flexible Elastomeric and Polyolefin Adhesive:  Comply with MIL-A-24179A, Type II, Class I, or manufacturer's recommended adhesive with equivalent performance.

findings.issue: ASTM C 871 reference should include edition year for chloride content testing. Current edition is ASTM C871-21.
findings.existingText: Products that come in contact with stainless steel shall have a leachable chloride content of less than 50 ppm when tested according to ASTM C 871.
findings.replacementText: Products that come in contact with stainless steel shall have a leachable chloride content of less than 50 ppm when tested according to ASTM C871-21.

findings.issue: ASTM C 795 reference for austenitic stainless steel insulation qualification should include edition year. Current edition is ASTM C795-08 (R2018).
findings.existingText: Insulation materials for use on austenitic stainless steel shall be qualified as acceptable according to ASTM C 795.
findings.replacementText: Insulation materials for use on austenitic stainless steel shall be qualified as acceptable according to ASTM C795-08 (R2018).

findings.issue: The specification for corrosion coating on carbon steel piping operating between 32 and 300 deg F seems overly restrictive and may add unnecessary cost. Standard practice for most HVAC applications does not require epoxy coating under insulation unless specific corrosion concerns exist. Consider limiting this requirement to outdoor or high-humidity applications.
findings.existingText: Carbon Steel:  Coat carbon steel operating at a service temperature between 32 and 300 deg F with an epoxy coating.
findings.replacementText: Carbon Steel:  For outdoor applications or applications in high-humidity environments, coat carbon steel operating at a service temperature between 32 and 300 deg F with an epoxy coating. Consult coating manufacturer for appropriate coating materials and application methods.
